benchmark_details.name: QualiSpeech
benchmark_details.overview: QualiSpeech is a comprehensive low-level speech quality assessment dataset that includes detailed natural language descriptions, enabling richer insights into speech qualities compared to traditional numerical scoring methods.
benchmark_details.data_type: speech quality assessment with natural language descriptions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for evaluating the low-level speech understanding capabilities of auditory large language models (LLMs).
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may not cover all possible aspects of speech quality, and annotations are derived from a single listener per sample, which may affect score reliability.

data.source: The dataset includes diverse synthetic and real speech samples sourced from the BVCC dataset, NISQA, and other synthetic speech models.
data.annotation: The data is annotated by a single listener, generating scores and natural language descriptions for various low-level speech aspects.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated to assess the accuracy of the scores and the relevance of descriptions generated by auditory LLMs.
methodology.interpretation: Scores closer to 1 indicate better performance in predicting speech quality and the accuracy of natural language assessments.
methodology.validation: The performance of models is validated against human evaluations and compared with traditional metrics like MOS.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All annotators received clear guidelines and fair compensation.
